other_tests.findings: Normally shaped hypoplastic gland located in the appropriate anatomical position in the neck.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Did not respond after administration of bovine TSH in terms of 131I uptake, serum thyroid hormones, and thyroglobulin secretion.

other_tests.findings: Homozygous inactivating mutation of the TSH receptor consisting of the substitution of an isoleucine for a threonine at position 477 (T477I).
Basal GH concentration increased to 21 ng/mL 60 min after insulin injection.
Serum TSH was within the normal range (2.3 mU/mL) and showed a normal response to TRH challenge (13 mU/mL at 30 min).
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 12 months, serum TSH was undetectable both basally and after TRH administration.

other_tests.date: A few months before first admission
other_tests.findings: Low total T4 (2.1 mg/dL) and T3 (51 ng/dL).
